message_1: What is the efficiency of a radiation detector that has an observed count rate of 500 counts per minute and is exposed to a source of 5000 decays per minute?
message_2:
The efficiency of a radiation detector is calculated by dividing the observed count rate by the source decay rate.

Efficiency = (Observed count rate) / (Source decay rate)

In this case, the observed count rate is 500 counts per minute, and the source decay rate is 5000 decays per minute.

Efficiency = (500 counts per minute) / (5000 decays per minute)

Efficiency = 0.1 or 10%

The efficiency of the radiation detector is 10%.
